poem:
**In the Swirl of Sirens**

Devon drifts in daily tides,  
a fragile craft on troubled seas,  
her father anchored in fading time.  
Simone, lost to distant siren songs,  
dances in illusions' embrace.  
And in the space between,  
a silent plea:  
for love to pierce the everyday storm.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sirens to Nine Perfect Strangers: the seven best shows to stream this week Pick of the weekSirens From Maid creator Molly Smith Metzler, this darkly comic drama is the story of another scrappy underdog. Devon (Meghann Fahy) is struggling to keep her head above water, barely holding down a job while looking after a father with dementia. She could do with some help from her sister Simone (Milly Alcock) who has fallen under the spell". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
